abstract: Episcopal General Convention, top legislative body of Episcopal Church, elects Bishop Michael Curry of North Carolina as its presiding bishop, making him first African-American to hold position in church's history; Curry will lead sect's nearly 1.9 million members.
lead_paragraph: Bishop Michael Curry of North Carolina is to take charge of the denomination at a time when fewer Americans are formally affiliating with a particular religious group.

headline.main: Episcopal Church Elects Its First Black Presiding Bishop
headline.print_headline: Episcopal Church Elects Its First Black Leader

snippet: Bishop Michael Curry of North Carolina is to take charge of the denomination at a time when fewer Americans are formally affiliating with a particular religious group.
